item.description:
EVENT: Enjoy historic Salem for the birthday of our country! We will walk about 0.5 miles
as a group to picnic and enjoy the bands, pops concert, and air force fly over at Derby Park
by the harbor, culminating with beautiful fireworks. Dinner can be purchased in Salem or
brought from home. After the fireworks (about 9:45), there will be an optional Salem ferry ride
back to Boston (the ferry is 2 blocks from Derby Park). Last year, the ferry ride was spectacular!
and we witnessed the entire coastline's array of fireworks (including Boston's grand finale!). If
you are planning on taking the ferry back to Boston (Salem is accessible via MBTA Commuter
Rail for your trip *to* Salem), you should purchase a ticket as soon as possible; this option will
fill up fast.
Trip's Coordinator: Mosaicwalks@yahoo.com
RSVP REQUIRED (include a phone number and email address) for this trip as there are many
options and details. Contact the TC by email, before July 3rd. Drizzle cancels.
MEET: We will meet outside by the fountain in front of the Peabody Essex Museum at 4pm.
COST: Return ferry cost is $13 +$5 non-members. Consult www.mbta.com for schedule and
pricing for commuter rail service to Salem and salemferry.com for information on the Ferry.
item.how_to_find_us: RSVP to Mosaicwalks@yahoo.com for more details.

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: INDEPENDENCE DAY SPECTACULAR IN SALEM
